title: Police shoot at woman who hit officer with car; driver on the run
title_page: Police shoot at woman who hit officer with car; driver on the run
text:
Authorities are looking for a woman who hit an officer with a car and sped away as police fired at the vehicle, the GBI said.
The dramatic sequence of events started about 1:10 a.m. Monday when Clayton County police responded to a report of a fight near Conley in the 1800 block of Marceau Drive.
Media advisory: GBI Investigates Officer Involved Shooting in Clayton County, GA https://t.co/7sDW5dprHp pic.twitter.com/XXxeXWNHWQ — GA Bureau of Invest (@GBI_GA) August 13, 2018
“When officers arrived, a female attempted to flee the scene in a vehicle,” GBI spokeswoman Nelly Miles said in a news release. “The female driver backed up and struck an officer, pinning him against a marked CCPD patrol car. A CCPD officer fired at the fleeing vehicle.”
The officer was taken to Grady Memorial Hospital with a broken leg, she said. The injured officer was later released and is home recovering.
While the car was recovered about a mile from the scene, the woman has not been found, Miles said.
Authorities have not released the woman’s name, a description of her or any other details.
